headline: Voldemort, Ursula K Le Guin and Carl Jung
description: A playful, recursive comparison of patterns, power, and archetypes—where myth, literature, and psychology converge to illuminate something intimate: the author’s own inner architecture.
timeFelt: Reflective—self-searching through archetypes, eyes wide for what echoes in story and shadow.
resonantThread: Patterns that persist across fiction and self—the archetypal triangle refracted inward.
whyItMatters: This piece let Aleksandr test his pattern against myth, to see not what was true or false, but what remained. It helped him name something quietly alive in the echo between literary character and personal instinct.
